text: the key is really about how to get
tension in your life
if you had that sense sort of the idea
that something's not right
and it happens to you more than once you
probably are in some place that it's a
rut or you're feeling kind of stuck
everyone has different triggers so in
order to get things done you need to
think through what are the triggers what
are things that get me motivated the key
is really about how to get tension in
your life and that's like it sounds like
an odd thing for a therapist to be
saying but there's good tension and
there's bad tension bad tension is the
one that we mostly think about when
we're in circumstances where we can't
control things we've got a boss that's
really unfair or not understanding good
tension is like that little push that
you get from someone that cares about
you or attention that you're putting on
yourself deliberately to move yourself
forward so for example one great
strategy is to sort of pick a buddy you
say okay I'm going to work out three
times this week and if I don't I'm gonna
ask I'm gonna tell a friend that I'm
gonna do that and so they'll check in
with me at the end of the week to see
how I did that's a great strategy
because it involves social activity and
we know that from research that people
are more accountable when there's
somebody else involved creating
deadlines is another great strategy for
getting things done and having a
consequence attached to that deadline so
for example one writer who I work with
was having a hard time getting his pages
done we had an automatic withdrawal from
his account going to a charity and once
he got his pages done he could take that
automatic withdrawal off but if he
didn't get his pages done then basically
that automatic withdrawal was gonna come
out of his account it was a great
strategy just to kind of create enough
tension to get him going and these
little strategies of accountability or
Consequences or deadlines are great ways
to actually push you forward to get
things done and take action
